explanation: The program appended the top row twice when building the list of outer elements (the final for-loop 'for i in range(N): rotate_list.append(A[0][i])' is the duplicate). That caused duplicated entries and an incorrect rotation. I fixed it by removing that duplicate append (replacing the loop with a no-op 'pass'), leaving the correct sequence of outer elements intact so the subsequent rotation logic works. (No retrieved diff directly matched this exact fix.)
